question:
With respect to the government announcement regarding the National Population Register/ NPR, consider the following statements:
  1. It is also known as the National Register of Citizens.
  2. A usual resident is also used to describe a person who intends to reside in a local area for minimum of next 6 months.
  3. It is mandatory for NRIs to be registered in the NRC.
Which of the above statements are correct? Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The NPR is not the same as NRC. NPR is an exercise to create a comprehensive database of every usual resident in the country. It will be carried out throughout the country except Assam, as the NRC exercise is taking place there. The NPR will contain demographic as well as biometric data of the usual residents.  Statement 2 is correct: Usual residents are those who have been residing in a local area for a minimum period of 6 months. It can also be applied to persons who intend to be resident in a local area for a period of 6 months or more. The NPR is created under the provisions of the Citizenship Act, 1955. The NPR is used for making the National Register of Indian Citizens/ NRIC after verification of their citizenship status.  Statement 3 is incorrect: It is mandatory only for all resident citizens to be registered in the NPR. An NRI/ non-resident Indian would not count as usual resident until he/she resides for a minimum of 6 months. Hence it is not mandatory for an NRI to be registered in NPR until he/she becomes usual resident.
